LLMAgentR 0.2.0

Try an operation with exponential back-off

Source: R/build_weather_agent.R
try_with_retry.Rd

Repeatedly calls a *zero-argument* function up to `n_tries` times, pausing `backoff * 2^(i - 1)` seconds after each failure (i.e., 2, 4,8 .seconds when `backoff = 2`). If the function succeeds, its return value is passed through; otherwise the last captured error is re-thrown.

Usage

try_with_retry(fn, n_tries = 3, backoff = 2)

Arguments

fn

A function of **no arguments** to execute.

n_tries

Integer. Maximum number of attempts. Default`3`.

backoff

Numeric. Base delay in seconds for the exponential back-off sequence. Default`2`.

Value

Whatever `fn()` returns on the first successful run. If all attempts fail the function calls `stop()`.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Retry a flaky network call up to five times
try_with_retry(function() readLines("https://httpbin.org/status/500"),
               n_tries = 5, backoff = 1)
} # }
